title: CNBC Daily Open: Tech is back
description: Technology stocks and chipmakers helped major U.S. indexes regain their footing after ending last week in the red.

title: Feds say Trump not entitled to 'special treatment' in documents case
description: Former President Donald Trump is charged with retaining classified government records at his Mar-a-Lago club after leaving the White House.

title: Lloyd Blankfein says he 'can’t imagine' returning to Goldman Sachs
description: Blankfein, a former CEO of Goldman Sachs, pushed back on a report saying he had offered to return to the firm to help current CEO David Solomon.

title: Nvidia stock jumps 7% after Morgan Stanley says chipmaker benefits from 'massive shift' in A.I.
description: With companies flocking to generative artificial intelligence, Nvidia is poised to keep benefitting, Morgan Stanley analysts said in a report.

title: How Temu makes money from super-cheap goods like $10 smartwatches
description: Bargain e-commerce company Temu has had a whirlwind 2023. Quietly launching its app in September 2022, it only took the company a few weeks to top app store charts, edging out Amazon, Walmart and even fast-fashion brand Shein.

title: UBS to pay $1.4 billion over fraud in residential mortgage-backed securities
description: The Swiss bank's settlement is the final case prosecutors brought over misconduct that led up to the global financial crisis.

title: Four reasons why the consumer is so confusing — and what that may mean for retail earnings
description: As Home Depot, Target and Walmart report earnings, retailers and investors have had to weigh contradictory factors as they predict consumer spending patterns.

title: Hawaii wildfires leave at least 96 dead, more than $5 billion in damage in worst blaze in a century
description: Maui Police Chief John Pelletier said on Saturday that search dogs have only gone through 3% of the disaster area in the historic town of Lahaina so far.

title: Argentina devalues its currency, jacks up interest rates after shock far-right primary win
description: Argentinian stocks and its sovereign dollar bonds were also lower Monday.

title: Saudi soccer league lures Brazilian star Neymar as it seeks to attract 'exceptional players only'
description: Al-Hilal also reportedly bid for PSG and France national team prodigy Kylian Mbappé, for a one-year contract worth up to 700 million euros.

title: China wants to keep Russia in a 'Goldilocks' state — not too strong and not too weak
description: The dynamic between Beijing and Moscow is more nuanced than it appears on the surface, with neither side wanting the other to become too powerful.

title: Tesla shares drop after company announces China price cuts
description: Tesla shares fell after the company announced a fresh round of price cuts for the Model Y in mainland China.

title: Intuit's Alex Chriss named new PayPal CEO
description: Intuit's Alex Chriss named new PayPal CEO

title: Russian ruble slumps to near 17-month low, moves past 100 against the dollar
China's economic challenges gather steam as new loans plunge, property fears loom
description: Credit data for July released Friday showed a slump in demand from businesses and households to borrow money for the future.

title: Malaysia's state polls were a 'setback' for Anwar's ruling government, says analyst
description: The contest was widely seen as a first test for Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim's coalition and unity government that came to power last November.

title: Yen breaches 145 mark against the dollar, prompting expectations of BOJ intervention
description: On Friday, the Japanese currency briefly touched the same key psychological level, prompting speculation of intervention by the Bank of Japan.

title: Global rice prices could surge higher as flood risks loom over China
description: Global rice markets could come under further strain as the world's leading producer China grapples with heavy rain and flood risks, according to Fitch Ratings.

title: India is a rising force in Southeast Asia as region seeks to counter China's dominance
description: New Delhi's growing rivalry with China, is also seen as influencing its strategic calculation to strengthen its presence.

title: Employees in Asia are spending the most time looking busy at work, says Slack report
description: The survey found that employees from India, Japan and Singapore reported spending more of their time on "performative work" than the global average.
